meanings.definition: A person or thing that removes or puts a head on something.
meanings.sent1: The headers at the factory were responsible for attaching the caps to the bottles.
meanings.sent2: The headers on the assembly line ensured each product had a top securely in place.
meanings.sent3: The headers in the kitchen were the ones in charge of adding the finishing touch to the dishes.
meanings.sent4: She was the header of the team, always leading and guiding others.
meanings.sent5: The headers in the game were the players who aimed the ball with their heads.

meanings.definition: A line of text serving to indicate what the passage below it is about.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper article had clear headers to show the main topics of each section.
meanings.sent2: In the report, the headers helped readers quickly understand the content of each paragraph.
meanings.sent3: The headers on the website made it easy to navigate through different sections.
meanings.sent4: The headers in the book were like signposts guiding the reader through the text.
meanings.sent5: The headers in the document were bold and informative, catching the reader's attention.

meanings.definition: A brick or stone laid at right angles to the face of a wall.
meanings.sent1: The mason carefully placed each header to create a sturdy and durable wall.
meanings.sent2: The headers in the construction were essential for adding strength and support to the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child used the header as a makeshift toy in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The header in the wall stood out like a bold punctuation mark in the architecture.
meanings.sent5: The header in the building's design added a unique touch to the overall appearance.
